value.title: Microsoft launches live transcriptions for Teams using 'cutting edge AI'
value.excerpt: Microsoft is rolling out its AI-powered live transcription service in Microsoft Teams, answering Zoom's recent expansion of its own live transcription feature. Competition remains fierce in the video-meeting market for live transcription functionality.

value.title: VMware And NVIDIA Bring A100 GPUs To vSphere 7 To Virtualize AI Acceleration
value.excerpt: With vSphere 7 Update 2 and NVIDIA AI Enterprise suite, the A100 GPU becomes available to VMware customers running AI workloads in the enterprise data center.

value.title: Tableau introduces a new class of AI-powered analytics for business
value.excerpt: Einstein Discovery 2021.1 drops this month and will let more people do more with clicks rather than code, the company says.

value.title: How Azure Percept Simplifies Building And Deploying AI Models At Edge
value.excerpt: Azure Percept platform attempts to simplify running AI at the edge. It’s a powerful edge computing platform for prototyping computer vision and conversational AI models and deploying them in production.

value.title: Shell Taps Accenture, Ripjar to Transform Risk Screening by Applying AI
value.excerpt: The multiyear deal builds on Accenture Ventures’ investment in Ripjar and a strategic alliance formed in 2018.

value.title: Natural Language Processing Market Growing at a CAGR 20.3% | Key Player Microsoft, Google, Amazon Web Services, Facebook, Intel
value.excerpt: The global Natural Language Processing (NLP) Market size to grow from USD 11.6 billion in 2020 to USD 35.1 billion by 2026, at a Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) of 20.3% during the forecast period.

value.title: 13 startups selected to join Microsoft AI for Social Impact programme
value.excerpt: Microsoft has announced that it will work with 13 startups to develop artificial intelligence solutions under its AI for Social Impact scheme

value.title: Webee and Semtech simplify LoRaWAN connectivity for growing low-power IoT app market
value.excerpt: Webee's No-Code End-to-End Solution Builder powered by Azure provides for very easy creation of IoT solutions using LoRaWAN connectivity.

value.title: Himax WE-I Plus AIoT Platform Receives Microsoft Azure IoT PnP Certification
value.excerpt: Himax Technologies, Inc. (Nasdaq: HIMX) (“Himax”), a leading supplier and fabless manufacturer of display drivers and other semiconductor products, today announced its ultralow power WE-I Plus AIoT Platform has been listed in the Azure Certified Device Catalog after receiving Microsoft Azure IoT PnP certification.

value.title: Webee’s No-Code End-to-End Solution Builder Software Democratizes IoT

value.excerpt: Tata Consultancy Services’ Crystallus™ Offering, Industry Cloud Focus, Tools and Automation Assets, and Broad SAP ERP Cloud Migration Experience, Highlighted as Key Strengths.

value.title: Microsoft’s Percept Precept: Industrial IoT Shifts From Solutions To Platforms
value.excerpt: I’ve often said that developing industrial IoT solutions is like building Ikea furniture with some parts missing and without instructions. Roanne Sones confirmed this view in her “AI to the Edge” Ignite presentation.

value.title: Microsoft, Amazon must face facial recognition data suits
value.excerpt: A Washington federal judge has ruled on motions to dismiss two nearly identical lawsuits against Amazon.com Inc and Microsoft Corp, rejecting the companies' bids to scrap an Illinois biometric privacy claim while asking for additional briefings before ruling on two

value.title: AI and X-rays: Identifying the many faces of COVID-19
value.excerpt: A digital diagnostic tool that uses artificial intelligence and cloud computing to accurately read vast numbers of chest X-rays – faster than a radiologist can – is helping doctors identify, triage and monitor COVID-19 patients.

value.title: Azure Arc Becomes The Foundation For Microsoft’s Hybrid And Multi-Cloud Strategy
value.excerpt: At the recent Spring Ignite conference, Microsoft announced the general availability of Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes, and the preview of Arc enabled machine learning.

value.title: Items filtered by date: March 2021

value.title: Elevating security and efficiency with Azure Sentinel, your cloud-native SIEM
value.excerpt: Modern security operations teams are now tasked with protecting sprawling digital estates against ever evolving threats. With Azure Sentinel, the first cloud-native SIEM on a major public cloud, you can modernize security operations to stay one step ahead.

value.title: Incentives for buying Microsoft devices boosted by automation
value.excerpt: Microsoft is using automation to reboot its incentives program for buying Microsoft Surface devices and other Microsoft devices.

value.title: Where is Snowflake going?
value.excerpt: The IPO got our attention. Given the huge expectations around the company, how will Snowflake differentiate itself in a landscape of data lakehouses and all-encompassing cloud analytic portfolios?

value.title: Microsoft edge AI kit runs Linux on i.MX8M and adds Myriad X and 8MP cam
value.excerpt: Microsoft’s $349 “Azure Percept DK” edge AI kit runs Linux on an i.MX8M and works with Azure IoT services. The kit has a “Vision” module with a 0.7 TOPS Myriad X and an 8MP camera plus an an optional “Audio” module with a 4-mic array.

value.title: Intento Announces Major Enhancement to its XTM Cloud Integration

value.title: RADCOM announces automated 5G assurance integration with Microsoft Azure

value.title: Splice Machine 3.1 enhances support for real-time AI deployments
value.excerpt: Splice Machine introduced a new version of its platform -- 3.1 -- that introduces tools to support real-time AI system deployment.

value.title: What the swarm of new Azure announcements mean
value.excerpt: This week's Azure announcements were about being more hybrid, more multi-cloud, more data-dependent -- at higher speed.

value.title: Microsoft’s Most Impactful Announcements At Ignite 2021
value.excerpt: Between pre-briefs, executive Q&As and the live event, I attended around twenty hours of Ignite 2021. Typically, Microsoft holds three focused events each year: one for developers ( Build ), channel partners ( Inspire) and end customers ( Ignite ).

value.title: Microsoft Power BI Premium: New platform and pricing, what you need to know
value.excerpt: It used to cost $5,000 a month and run on dedicated hardware; now it's a $20 per user cloud service, which proves that a multi-tenant architecture delivers better performance.
